news.author: By Zachary Clark Daily Journal staff
news.excerpt: On the November ballot is an eighth-cent sales tax for Caltrain that proponents say is needed to save the railroad from a pandemic-induced financial crisis and also realize plans to grow service to BART-like levels over the next two decades.
news.highlight: Without Caltrain, residents can expect traffic congestion to be worse than it was before the pandemic, proponents of the measure argue.“Voting yes on RR will remove thousands of cars from our highways every day,” reads the official ballot argument against the measure. “Without Caltrain, traffic congestion will soon be worse than before COVID-19.”
